name: Definition-Based Inference for Defect Severity
description: Uses explicit definitions to classify severity

theory.natural_language: A critical defect is defined as any defect that causes safety risk or data loss. A major defect disrupts core functionality without safety risk. Defect D1 causes safety risk. Defect D2 disrupts core functionality but no safety risk. Defect D3 is cosmetic.
expected_facts: major_defect DEFINED_AS disrupts_core_functionality AND NOT safety_risk

expected_answer.natural_language: Critical. It triggers the safety risk condition.
Major. It disrupts core functionality without safety risk.
expected_answer.explanation: DefectD2 DISRUPTS core_functionality ∧ NOT safety_risk ⇒ major_defect

expected_answer.natural_language: No. It is cosmetic and does not meet critical criteria.
expected_answer.explanation: DefectD3 IS cosmetic ∧ critical requires safety_risk or data_loss
